bug.short_desc: Desktop Elements grow to contain child windows whose min size exceeds Desktop layout

long_desc.thetext:
As described in my email here:
http://qooxdoo.678.n2.nabble.com/Issue-with-Desktop-Layouting-Scrolling-amp-Window-Minimum-Size-td7584420.html
With a working example here:
http://tinyurl.com/mhlhqt4
(For some reason, this example sometimes bugs out until you resize the window)
The Desktop object will not change its size when a window is dragged out of view, which I understand now is expected behavior, however, it WILL change size if the window's minimum dimensions also exceed the Desktop object's size.
To observe the strange behavior, simply try to drag the Window outside of the viewport. Note that the scrollbars do not appear until the red area of the window (which denotes the window's hand-configured minimum size) it outside of view.
As an outsider looking in, I can only speculate there's some bug involving layout computation for canvas elements and windows with minimum sizes.
This bug no longer appears in qx 3.0.1.
Thanks for the feedback. I guess we can close the bug then.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
